intro: Phyteuma globulariifolium subsp. pedemontanum, commonly known as the Alpine globose phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its rounded, globe-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to violet tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
